org.jetel.util.primitive

Class SimpleCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.primitive.SimpleCache<K,V>

  • public class SimpleCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple cache based on LinkedHashMap.
    It keeps LRU order of accessed items. When maximum capacity is reached and new item is to be stored, the Eldest entry is automatically removed. Simple cache supports more entries upon one key.
    Since:
    24.11.2005

        Returns:

      • put

        public boolean put(K key,
          V value)
        Stores the given value under the given key in the cache. If the cache is full, the eldest entry or entries (in case when duplicity is enabled) are removed so that storing of the new value succeeds.
        Parameters:
        key - the key under which the value should be stored
        value - the value to be stored
        Returns:
        true if the value was successfully stored in the cache, false otherwise

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key whose presence in this map is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key.
